page.title: 06INTERVIEW WITH MISS HANDY
page.content: Miss Handy retired in 1981 as deputy head of South Moor Greenland Junior School.She never missed a day's work in 40 years and attended a garden party at Buckingham Palace on her retirement. She still preaches in local Methodist churches because she feels it is something she has to do.She has been preaching 33 years and started when she lived in Annfield Plain. Most of her preaching is now done at South Moor Methodist Church,opened in 1932, but she still travels throughout Co.Durham,and especially likes to visit Whitleyhead Church about 3 miles outside Stanley. She visits South Moor Church many times during the week to help organize and arrange other activities,including the Boy's Brigade Choir Practice,the Toddlers Club and the Church Wives.
